Survey: M Castro 199211 BOUNDARY_UTM: boundary of La Selva Biological Station vector digital data
Puerto Viejo, Sarapiquí, Heredia, Costa Rica GIS-Lab. La Selva Biological Station
\\PELAMIS\q\dbls\new\limite\boundary_utm
La Selva Biological Station (LSBS) Boundaries
boundary_utm
The Arc/Info coverage, BOUNDARY_UTM, contains the boundaries of the La Selva Biological Station (LSBS), Costa Rica. The BOUNDARY_UTM coverage is part of the GIS laboratory database developed to support research, education and administrative management for LSBS. Procedures_Used: Ground survey, IKONOS satellite imagery, GPS points. en
1992

ArcInfo Coverage
Polygon topology present The north-east corner of the Flaminea property should be remeasured with DGPS points. Preliminary surveys with a GPS show that the Flaminea annex is larger than what appears in this coverage.

199211
Boundary
GIS Laboratory. La Selva Biological Station 10/16/2000 IKONOS 1-m Panchromatic Imagery Erdas Imagine format
See metadata for this data source for more information //falco/gis2/imagery/ikonos
1-m resolution IKONOS 1-m Panchromatic Imagery Main river boundaries were digitzed from August 2000 IKONOS satellite imagery, 1m pancromatic
1) Original boundary map came from a ground survey. Survey data verified and coverage digitized by Marco Castro. Rafael's House Swamp - Queb.Sabalo was updated in Feb.93. New boundaries for La Flaminea Annex in May 1993 and January 1994 August 11, 1993
Marco V. Castro C. Organization for Tropical Studies
GIS Laboratory Manager
physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí Heredia Costa Rica
mailing and physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) San Pedro San José Apartado 676-2050 Costa Rica
+506 766-6565 ext. 130 +506 766-6535 gis-mgr@sloth.ots.ac.cr 8am - 5pm (-0600 GMT) Please check the OTS home page to verify that the coverage contains the information you require before contacting the GIS laboratory manager.
2) Additional boundary lines in the La Guaria and La Flaminea Annexes were modified using DGPS points. August 2000
Matthew Clark Organization for Tropical Studies
GIS Laboratory Manager
physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí Heredia San José
mailing and physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) San Pedro San José Apartado 676 - 2050 Costa Rica
+ 506 766-6565 ext. 130 +506 766-6535 gis-mgr@sloth.ots.ac.cr 8am -5pm (-0600 GMT) Please check the OTS home page to verify that the coverage contains the information you require before contacting the GIS laboratory manager.
3) The Galeano Annex to the north of the Flaminea IDA property was surveyed using DGPS points and the streams coverage generated from the LIDAR-derived digital elevation model. August 2000
Matthew Clark Organization for Tropical Station
GIS Laboratory Manager
physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí Heredia Costa Rica
mailing and physical address La Selva Biological Statio (OTS) San Pedro San José Apartado 676 - 2050 Costa Rica
+ 506 766-6565 ext. 130 +506 766-6535 gis-mgr@sloth.ots.ac.cr 8am - 5pm (-0600 GMT) Please check the OTS home page to verify that the coverage contains the information you require before contacting the GIS laboratory manager.
4) The boundary along the Puerto Viejo, Peje and Sarapiquí Rivers was digitized from an August, 2000 IKONOS satellite image. Changes made to Tosi's property boundary in Flaminea using DGPS points surveyed in the field. 11/31/00
Matthew Clark Organization for Tropical Studies
GIS Laboratory Manager
physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí Heredia Costa Rica
mailing and physical address La Selva Biological Station (OTS) San Pedro San José Apartado 676-2050 Costa Rica
+506 766- 6565 ext. 130 +506 766-6535 gis-mgr@sloth.ots.ac.cr 8:00am - 5:00pm (-0600 GMT) Please check the OTS home page to verify that the coverage contains the information you require before contacting the GIS laboratory manager.
5) The Sabalo-Esquina boundary was digitzed from a combination of August 2000 1-m IKONOS imagery and GPS points (not differentially corrected) taken along the stream from the SHO trail crossing to the Puerto Viejo River. 02/09/01
Matthew Clark OTS
GIS Laboratory Manager
Antonio TrabuccoThe boundaries were updated for the new annex. The annex was surveyed by field crew in 2001.02/01/2002Dataset moved.q:\dbls\old\otsdb\ls_utm\boundary_utm2009033016590500
